subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit How to run the same test with different data (how about Cactus)
msgSnippet: ... You can t, as the book says. :) Check back with Cactus, though: I told Vince about this and he said he might try to fix the problem. The question is
messageBody:
zoran_101 wrote:

> Thanks, this helped a lot, and also I happen to have the JUnit
> Recepies book so I just looked it up. However it looks like that I
> will have to run my tests in a container, meaning I have to use
> Cactus. I don't think I can do this with Cactus because they
> instantiate TestCase. If there is a way I would love to know.

You can't, as the book says. :)

Check back with Cactus, though: I told Vince about this and he said he
might try to fix the problem. The question is whether it was high enough
priority to be done.

You have a few choices:

1. Use Cactus, but be forced to use the "check()" pattern that someone
on this list mentioned. (Kevin? Chris?)

2. Change the test so that it doesn't need to run in a container, then
apply the Parameterized Test Case pattern. The book is full of
suggestions for moving tests outside of the container.

What's the reason for the container in the first place?

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
